descriptionPlain:
What are we looking for?
We are looking for motivated software engineers to join our team in Spain. You will solve challenging technical problems, own your products end-to-end and help take the company to the next level. This is a great opportunity to join an amazing team, and also to have an impactful role in the way we take our platform to the next stage.
We’ve got a culture focused on passion, kindness, continual learning, and feedback… and our people love it. Come find out why!
As a Software Engineer II at Eventbrite, you will build beautiful, scalable, robust and secure platforms and, why not, user interfaces, that people are excited to use every day while pushing the technological envelope with novel architectural advancements. In addition to improving the quality and effectiveness at EB, while designing prototypes and mentoring colleagues.

The Tech Stack
Python and Django are the primary off-the-shelf technologies in our stack, while modernizing our platform to Kotlin, we are hosted on AWS, and on the frontend, we make extensive use of React and Redux.

lists.content:
• You have 3+ years of experience building applications at scale in at least one popular programming language, such as Python, Java, PHP, Ruby, C#, C++, etc
  • You have 2+ years of experience using some form of web framework: Django, Symphony, Rails, ASP.net, etc.
  • You have experience managing infrastructure on a platform like AWS/GCP/Azure
  • You have 2+ years of experience using a SQL database: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MSSQL, etc
  • You have knowledge of microservices and/or Service Oriented Architecture
  • You are an efficient, practical programmer, designed and producing dependable code
  • You care about making sure your code is maintainable and well tested
  • You have a holistic approach to quality
  • You are a results-driven self-starter with great communication and collaboration skills; we put a lot of emphasis on being team players
  • You enjoy teaching and mentoring colleagues

• You have experience working with modern frontend frameworks: React, Backbone/Marionette, etc
  • You have experience designing and developing APIs, both internal service and HTTP APIs
  • Familiarity with continuous integration tools like Jenkins/ CircleCI

descriptionPlain:
THE CHALLENGE
Eventbrite's business continues to grow and scale rapidly, powering millions of events. Event creators and attendees need new tools and technologies that empower them to have the most meaningful live experiences. As an Engineering Manager, you will inspire, mentor, and develop the team that builds this global platform. 


THE ROLE
As an Engineering Manager in the Consumer world, you are responsible for a team whose primary customers are event goers when searching at eventbrite.com and eventbrite attendee app. You will need to partner with Design and Product to empower users on:


Find: something specific (i.e Ocktober Fest), 
Discover: discover what they would like to do (i.e yoga this weekend for free)
Inspire them: I have an open weekend and I don’t know what to do 
 
You’ll refine our software development lifecycle process, clarify design requirements, and accelerate progress. You'll support the career growth of our engineers and provide opportunities to distinguish themselves as they drive impact throughout our organization.

lists.content:
• Manage a team of software engineers
  • Measure velocity and improve efficiency for the team
  • Drive change effectively across our organization
  • Maintain regular communication with the leadership team
  • Take ownership of career development for engineers on the team.
  • Drive innovation in processes and strategies throughout your business unit.
  • Lead your team to success on important initiatives even during times of frequent distractions and occasionally conflicting priorities.
  • Develop a sustainable, healthy environment for your engineers that is engaging, encouraging, and challenging.

• 3 years experience in engineering leadership and people management
  • Demonstrated ability to grow and lead high-functioning and diverse engineering teams geographically distributed across the world
  • You’re a polyglot with a solid technical background and the ability to contribute to software design and architectural discussions as a player coach.
  • Experience building early-stage consumer products, applying concepts like experimentation, rapid prototyping, and user research in engineering
  • Experience working with a highly collaborative remote-first environment, driving a team that ships code to production often.
  • Working knowledge of fundamental cloud technologies, preferably within AWS.
  • Experience working with Search, Personalization or any other type of indexing, relevance and information retrieval

descriptionPlain:
THE CHALLENGE
The global Customer Success team is dedicated to empowering attendees and creators through help interactions that are easy, accessible, educational, and tailored. As Eventbrite’s customer base grows and evolves, we need to thoughtfully leverage data to ensure our customer experience grows and evolves with them. This role will be filled by a self-starter who will equip Customer Success leaders with data and interpretations to inform and drive business decisions.

THE TEAM
Partnering daily with Customer Success leadership, this role sits in the Business Operations team. We are responsible for supporting the Sales and Success teams by managing the infrastructure that helps them achieve global revenue targets and provide best in class customer experience. We are a small but mighty team focused on driving global consistency and excellence through process improvement and analytics to uncover actionable insights – both at the strategic and tactical levels.

THE ROLE
The Success Data Analyst will utilize SQL to identify actionable insights – both at the strategic and tactical levels - that drive business decisions, regularly presenting to business leaders and executive management. Their work will help optimize the customer experience by building deliverables that facilitate timely and responsive action, measuring the impact of program changes, and conducting analyses to proactively uncover opportunities for improvement in quality or scale. To be successful in this role, they will need to be disciplined, proactive, and curious. The ideal candidate is an experienced business analyst who loves challenges and succeeds at juggling multiple assignments in a fast-paced environment. 

We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas.

lists.content:
• Translate both strategic and tactical questions into analytics requirements, collect and analyze data using SQL, and organize the findings in a cohesive narrative to drive action
  • Deliver recurring Customer Success metrics packs across the reactive, proactive, and self-service offerings
  • Develop scalable reporting and dashboards to monitor leading and lagging indicators 
  • Identify opportunities to improve process, efficiency, profitability, and productivity 
  • Assist in setting targets for new initiatives and proactive campaigns, tracking ongoing progress

• Required Skills: Minimum 2 years experience with SQL, Excel,  and Tableau (or equivalent software)
  • 2-5 years of relevant experience in data science, analytics, or consulting 
  • Familiarity with customer success metrics, including knowledge base / help center, support, and proactive outreach key performance indicators
  • Proven analytical and quantitative skills with an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses 
  • Preferred Skills: Salesforce, Google Analytics, Genesys, Social Studio (or equivalent software)

descriptionPlain:
THE CHALLENGE

Eventbrite is the trusted marketplace for live experiences and our users expect to be able to post an event in minutes, buy a ticket in seconds, and start reaching their audience right now. Integrity teams ensure that each and every step goes smoothly: creators know they will be paid on time and consumers trust the experience will be high quality. And we’re always getting better, launching innovative features that delight customers but also introduce new risks to our business. 

THE TEAM

The Risk Data Science team develops machine learning and rules-based detection of risks across the platform. We work closely with an engineering team to integrate that detection directly into product flows and with integrity operations specialists to quickly remove bad actors and moderate user generated content. As a cross functional group, we pride ourselves on protecting the business without unnecessary friction for our customers. 

THE ROLE

As a Staff Level Data Scientist, you will use machine learning to solve problems across a wide variety of features across the Eventbrite platform from transaction monitoring to account security to abusive language detection. You will leverage your familiarity with classic approaches or learn new ones to develop practical, durable solutions to trust issues. You will implement those solutions for use in both real time and offline applications. You will design monitoring and feedback loops to confirm that our solutions remain reliable as the platform develops and our adversaries change tactics.

descriptionPlain:
THE CHALLENGE
Eventbrite is a people-first organization. Our goal of building the global platform for live experience relies on the foundation of top talent and strong company culture. Our team is the face of Eventbrite, and we’re charged with finding, attracting, and bringing on the best of the best to drive Eventbrite’s growing business and award-winning culture forward. Hiring the best talent globally is no easy feat. However, we have a talented team who has an inspiring story and mission. Our perfect candidate is someone who can connect that vision and story with top-notch talent.
 
THE TEAM
Our team is part of the Commerce area, where we provide our customers with a modern and efficient user experience to purchase tickets. We are responsible for the entire Order Processing flow and make sure that our platform is scalable, reliable and efficient.
 
THE ROLE
As Staff engineer, you’ll be in a preferred position to shape the technical direction of the area and keep ensuring Eventbrite’s platform evolves to satisfy our customers’ needs. You’ll be challenged to research, design and implement technical solutions and become a point of reference for the engineering teams.
You’ll work closely with the PM and the Engineering Manager and you’ll be responsible for the technical growth of the company, both internally mentoring engineers and externally interacting with many other teams.
 
THE TECH STACK
Our main stack is Python and Django, running on AWS. As we evolve as a company, more services are created and our tech stack will keep changing.

  • Active Eventbrite user with a passion for live events

descriptionPlain:
THE CHALLENGE
Eventbrite is maturing its program management practice to help deliver its strategic vision for its customers. As the leader in the mid market event management and ticketing industry we want to pivot to a new post pandemic world. The Program Management Office will be part of the engineering organization and focus on enabling delivery of market defining features while helping the development teams retool and refresh its technology stack. As the first few TPMs on the team part of the challenge is to influence the team on adopting new delivery practices.

THE TEAM
The TPM team at Eventbrite will be responsible for the delivery of key engineering features that drive customer success. This team is responsible for identifying and removing blockers and bottlenecks that impact the software development teams across geographies. They facilitate prioritization workshops to ensure alignment between product, engineering, marketing, R&D and other teams. TPM’s also help bring visibility into the software development production pipeline by publishing metrics and trends. TPM’s eliminate friction within and in between teams by continuous process improvement and influencing behaviours that breed success. 

THE ROLE
As a TPM this individual will assist with the execution of existing programs, will contribute to planning and facilitation of technical requirements, backlog refinement, retrospectives and other team level meetings and escalate blockers and provide solution options. This TPM individual will need to collaborate closely with the Engineering Strategy and Operations area and to manage operational tasks such as budget/cost optimization and financial reporting. This individual may get to manage new projects, planning project deliverables including sequencing deliverables to minimize blockage from dependencies, and facilitate team level workshops to flesh out achievable goals. They will partner with engineering managers, directors and engineers to understand the technology as well as the deliverables at the tactical level. This Senior TPM will put together the metrics required to keep track of all deliverables they are assigned. This individual contributor should be fluent in Agile methodologies and development tools and technologies. The TPM will need to be ready to deep dive into team activities in order to resolve issues with process or behaviors. They will take ownership of their team deliverables, eliminate blockers, identify risks and mitigations while empowering teams to do their best work.

THE TECH STACK
We are moving from a centralized monolithic architecture to a decentralized micro services architecture. This means changes to a lot of technologies that are currently in use across engineering. This also means changes to our CI\CD pipeline and the way we manage our source code. In addition to the move to microservices we are also moving to AWS managed solutions as opposed to solutions that are self managed. So switching from MySQL to Aurora and self managed Postgres to DynamoDb. This Sr. TPM will help roll these changes out across all teams and help drive Agile maturity in the infrastructure team.

CLICK HERE TO HEAR FROM OUR CHIEF CUSTOMER OFFICER!

THE TEAM
Our Sales team leads the charge on taking Eventbrite to market, acquiring and retaining our most valuable customers. We’re focused on delivering growth and profitability to the business through our obsession with helping customers find value in the platform. Our team is diverse, global and incredibly agile, hunting for wins and hungry for growth.
 
THE ROLE
You’ll lead our global Sales team, owning the Sales strategy and being accountable for driving profitable growth through customer acquisition, expansion and retention. 

You’re joining at an inflection point. One where you’ll lead the repositioning of Eventbrite from a ticketing platform into a ticketing sales engine, harnessing the unique value of Eventbrite’s demand-driving capabilities. You’ll bring transformational thinking around our go to market model to deliver this unique value proposition and differentiate us from competitors. 

You’ll also be a business leader, stepping beyond your functional responsibilities to help formulate the company’s growth strategy. You’ll work cross-functionally to prioritize around opportunities for growth and will lead by example in execution and a relentless pursuit of impact.

DIRECT REPORTS
Director - Sales, North America
Director - Sales, UK & Ireland
Director - Sales, Australia & New Zealand
Director - Commercial Management
Senior Manager - Sales Optimization

lists.content:
• Deep domain expertise in sales and commercial processes - has been there done that in terms of defining the model for success and delivering against targets. An expert in inside sales with an appreciation for how to adapt the model to evolving opportunities
  • Strategic thinker - Understands the role sales plays in driving growth. Brings a balance of assertiveness in striving for sales growth and pragmatism in making the right trade-offs for customer value and overall company success
  • Change agent - Has led the repositioning of a brand or value proposition. Knows what it takes to drive change both internally and externally
  • Expert communicator and influencer - Is known as an inspirational leader. Flexes style as needed to ensure clarity and buy-in
  • Driven by results - Finds ways to hit targets and always delivers for the business. Knows how to execute successfully and is relentless in doing so. Holds self and team to an impeccable standard of accountability
  • Strong analytical skills and financial acumen - Digs in and problem solves. P&L savvy and responsible for the bottom line, not just the top
  • Willingness to roll up sleeves and get scrappy to get things done - Knows how to get wins, build momentum and balance executing on “no regrets” actions with longer-term strategic progress
  • Excellent business acumen and communication skills - Works effectively across functions to balance influencing for the change they believe in and the best outcomes for the business, not just the function. 
  • A business leader with experience in organization design and hiring strong leaders who demonstrate critical thinking and strong execution skills. Leads by example to develop the culture of the organization

descriptionPlain:
THE CHALLENGE
Eventbrite has built the leading events marketplace, enabling entrepreneurs around the world to build and grow their businesses with live events while helping event-goers discover unique, local things to do. Today, our creators increasingly rely on Eventbrite to distribute their events, drive consumer demand, and help them grow their ticket sales and ultimately their businesses. We are looking for an experienced growth leader to take this value proposition to market to drive the acquisition of creators as well as fuel the demand side of the marketplace by acquiring more event-goers across all paid and owned channels. 

THE TEAM
Growth Marketing resides at the intersection of marketing, sales, product, engineering, and analytics with a strong emphasis on experimentation and impact. The team requires a highly specialized marketing skill set that is a unique blend of technical, operational, and creative talents. The team is highly collaborative, results-oriented, and fast-paced. Reporting directly to the CMO, you will also work closely with the Chief Executive Officer and the executive team.  

THE ROLE
You will be responsible for evolving and setting the company’s growth strategy and leading a team of growth marketers, including performance marketing, SEO, demand generation, and international growth tasked with growing both sides of our marketplace. You will be required to lead operating model evolution, leading the team through change as we up-level our capabilities. You will partner closely with Product Development, Engineering, and Sales to drive alignment and ensure that our acquisition strategies and tactics are best-in-class, performant, and optimized. This is a unique opportunity to make a significant impact on a high-growth company in a fast-moving dynamic marketplace. The leader should be able to mentor and motivate a marketing team to solve complex problems and shape and bring to life innovative growth initiatives through quick experimentation and new technologies and tools.

lists.content:
• Design and lead implementation of growth strategy by using paid and organic media channels to grow new user acquisition, partnering closely with Sales, Product and Engineering leadership.
  • Lead SEO strategy and drive cross-functional execution across Marketing, Product, and Engineering teams. 
  • Lead rapid experimentation of new channels, campaigns, creative, incentives, and approaches.
  • Optimize the creator user journey to ensure we are delivering the right lead to the right conversion channel (sales or self-sign-on (SSO)). 
  • Uncover new channels and opportunities to scale our sales channel.
  • Experiment to determine the correct model and channels for consumer (event-goer) acquisition.
  • Own marketing attribution decisions, working closely with Data and Analytics teams to strengthen our tracking and measurement.
  • Partner deeply with the creative team to develop creative and performant campaigns. 
  • Develop and manage the annual plan and budget and, in collaboration with FP&A, adjust plans monthly based upon realized return on investment.
  • Recruit and lead a team of skilled growth marketers to drive growth strategy, campaign ideation, execution, and analysis, continually raising the bar on technical and analytical skills.
  • Report key learnings and performance to the executive team on a recurring basis.

• 15+ years of Growth Marketing, leading both SEO and Performance Marketing at both B2C and B2B companies.
  • Have worked in hyper-growth and scaled tech companies.
  • Strong marketing instincts and proven track record of shaping and executing successful user growth strategies.
  • Deep understanding of Marketing Technology and media platforms (e.g. Meta, Google, etc.)
  • Strong analytics background and ability to synthesize, analyze and interpret data and transfer into actionable strategy.
  • Strong leadership presence; serves as a senior leader within a company, influential with a cross-functional group of stakeholders and can create buy-in with both technical and operational teams.
  • Proven people leader having built strong and diverse teams with high employee engagement.

• Experience in brand media and ability to lead local and national media buys
  • Experience leading a global team
